footer_title: Aide Sans Frontières. Inspired by the work of MSF.
footer_disclaimer: Aide Sans Frontières is dedicated to cross-border humanitarian assistance initiatives.

donation_impact_25: Provides essential antibiotics to treat 5 children with pneumonia.
donation_impact_50: Can provide a full course of therapeutic food to save a malnourished child.
donation_impact_100: Equips a mobile clinic team with essential emergency medical kits.
donation_impact_250: Supplies a family emergency shelter kit including a tent and blankets.
emergency_subtitle: Hospitals are overwhelmed and running out of essential supplies. Your immediate support can provide life-saving materials.
emergency_days_left: days left to reach our goal
involved_summary_desc: Every action, big or small, contributes to our life-saving work. Join us to make a difference in the lives of people caught in crisis.
about_subtitle: An independent, global movement providing medical aid where it's needed most. For over 50 years, we have been a lifeline in crises, guided by our principles of neutrality, impartiality, and independence.
history_1971_desc: A group of French doctors and journalists, believing in the right to humanitarian intervention, create Médecins Sans Frontières.
history_1979_desc: The organization publicly condemns the atrocities in Cambodia, establishing the principle of 'témoignage' or 'bearing witness'.
history_1985_desc: A massive nutritional intervention is launched to combat widespread famine, setting new standards for emergency feeding programs.
history_1999_desc: Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for its pioneering humanitarian work on several continents.
history_2014_desc: Mounts its largest-ever response to an epidemic, caring for thousands of patients during the deadly Ebola outbreak.
history_2020s_desc: Adapting to new challenges including the COVID-19 pandemic, climate-related disasters, and complex, protracted conflicts worldwide.
history_2024_hk_desc: Expanding our global reach, a regional hub is established in Hong Kong to better coordinate operations in the Asia-Pacific region.
values_neutrality_desc: We do not take sides in armed conflicts. We provide medical care based on needs alone, regardless of political, economic, or religious interests.
values_impartiality_desc: Access to healthcare is a right. We give priority to those in the most serious and immediate danger, without discrimination.
values_independence_desc: Over 90% of our funding comes from private donors. This financial independence allows us to act quickly and without political interference.
team_subtitle: Our strength lies in our people. We are a diverse team of dedicated professionals from around the globe, working together to save lives.
team_medical_desc: Doctors, nurses, surgeons, and mental health specialists who provide direct patient care.
team_logistics_desc: Experts who build hospitals, manage supply chains, and ensure clean water and sanitation.
team_admin_desc: Coordinators, HR, and finance staff who ensure our projects run smoothly and accountably.
map_subtitle: Our teams are currently active in over 70 countries, responding to emergencies and providing long-term medical care.
map_alt_text: A world map showing global humanitarian aid projects.
involved_subtitle: Your support is crucial. Whether you donate, volunteer, attend an event, or share a story, you are part of the movement that delivers lifesaving medical care.
donate_one_time_desc: Every single contribution provides immediate relief to those in desperate need. Your gift today can save a life.
donate_monthly_desc: Become a Field Partner. Your steady support allows us to plan ahead and respond at a moment's notice.
donate_project_desc: Direct your support to a specific area of our work, from emergency responses to long-term care programs.
patreon_desc: Join our community on Patreon for exclusive updates and behind-the-scenes content.
volunteer_form_subtitle: We are always looking for skilled and passionate individuals. Fill out the form below to express your interest.
volunteer_motivation_placeholder: Briefly tell us about your skills and why you want to join us...
volunteer_success_message: Thank you for your interest! We have received your application and will be in touch if a suitable opportunity arises.
events_subtitle: Connect with us, learn more about our work, and meet other supporters.
event1_title: Online Webinar: A Day in the Life of a Field Worker
event1_desc: Join us for a live Q&A session with experienced field staff who will share their stories from the frontlines.
event2_desc: Lace up your running shoes and join our annual 5K run to raise funds for our emergency medical programs.
stories_subtitle: Personal stories are a powerful way to raise awareness. Whether you're a former patient, a field worker, or a supporter, we invite you to share your experience.
stories_success_message: Thank you for sharing your story! It has been submitted for review. Your voice helps bring our work to life.
transparency_subtitle: We believe in accountability. Every dollar you donate is a trust you place in us, and we are committed to showing you the impact of your generosity and the efficiency of our operations.
reports_subtitle: Explore our annual reports for a detailed overview of our activities, financial statements, and the impact of our work around the globe.
report_2023_desc: A comprehensive look at our projects, achievements, and financial accountability throughout 2023.
report_2022_desc: Detailed analysis of our response to global crises and financial performance in 2022.
funding_subtitle: We are committed to maximizing the funds that go directly to our lifesaving programs in the field.
funding_programs_desc: Direct medical care, logistics, and support for our field projects.
funding_admin_desc: Essential operational support to ensure our projects run effectively and efficiently.
funding_fundraising_desc: Raising awareness and funds to continue our mission.
audits_subtitle: Our financial statements are audited annually by independent, certified public accountants to ensure accuracy and compliance with the highest standards.
api_subtitle: For researchers, journalists, and the public. We provide access to anonymized, aggregated project data to foster understanding and innovation in the humanitarian sector.
api_description: Our API provides programmatic access to historical data on project locations, types of interventions, and funding levels. Access is free for non-commercial use.
donations_subtitle: A transparent record of all donations received, reflecting our commitment to accountability.
pm_subtitle: Dashboard for monitoring and managing active humanitarian projects.
pm_select_project: Select a project below to view its detailed operational dashboard.
pm_no_updates: No updates are available for this project yet.
education_subtitle: Knowledge is a powerful tool in humanitarian work. Explore our resources to learn more about global health, emergency response, and our ongoing efforts to improve medical aid.
knowledge_subtitle: Practical guides and manuals for health workers and the public.
knowledge1_desc: A comprehensive guide to essential first aid techniques for common injuries in crisis settings.
knowledge2_desc: Guidelines on identifying symptoms, managing treatment centers, and implementing water sanitation to stop outbreaks.
knowledge3_desc: How to use MUAC tapes and other methods to screen children for malnutrition.
knowledge4_desc: Sharing our latest humanitarian medical research, including field-tested treatment protocols for Noma, a neglected disease affecting impoverished communities.
training_subtitle: Online courses for aspiring and current humanitarian aid workers.
training1_desc: A foundational course covering the principles, history, and key actors in the humanitarian sector. (Beginner, 4 weeks)
training2_desc: An advanced course for medical professionals on diagnosing and treating diseases prevalent in our project areas. (Advanced, 8 weeks)
cases_subtitle: In-depth analysis of our responses to major humanitarian crises.
case1_desc: An examination of the logistical, medical, and ethical challenges faced during one of the largest natural disaster responses in modern history.
case2_title: Case Study: Ebola Outbreak in West Africa, 2014
case2_desc: Lessons learned from establishing and managing Ebola Treatment Centers, community engagement, and the development of new protocols.
papers_subtitle: We are committed to research and innovation that improves the effectiveness of humanitarian aid.
paper1_title: Effectiveness of Community-Based Management of Acute Malnutrition in the Sahel
paper1_desc: Published in The Lancet Global Health, in collaboration with the University of London.
paper2_title: Rapid Diagnostic Tests vs. Microscopy for Malaria Diagnosis in Conflict Zones
paper2_desc: A field study comparing the efficacy of different diagnostic tools. Published in the Journal of Tropical Medicine.
partnerships_subtitle: Collaboration is at the heart of our impact. We partner with leading corporations, institutions, and academic centers to extend our reach and enhance our capabilities.
sponsors_subtitle: We are grateful for the support of our corporate partners who provide critical funding, in-kind donations, and expertise.
sponsors_tier_platinum_desc: Our highest level of partnership, providing comprehensive support across multiple projects and emergency responses.
sponsors_tier_gold_desc: Significant contributors who provide substantial funding for specific large-scale projects.
sponsors_tier_silver_desc: Key supporters who enable our ongoing operations and specific programmatic needs.
donors_subtitle: Our work is made possible through strategic partnerships with foundations and government agencies dedicated to global health and humanitarian aid.
donor_echo: European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (ECHO)
academic_subtitle: We partner with leading academic institutions to conduct research, innovate new solutions, and improve the evidence base for humanitarian action.
academic_hopkins: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health
academic_hopkins_desc: Joint research on infectious disease epidemiology and field-based clinical trials.
academic_lshtm: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine
academic_lshtm_desc: Collaboration on studies related to malnutrition, vaccine efficacy, and health systems in low-resource settings.
academic_harvard_desc: Partnership on training programs for humanitarian leaders and research into the ethics of aid.
partner_form_subtitle: Join us in our mission. We are seeking partners who share our commitment to saving lives and alleviating suffering. Please fill out the form below to start a conversation.
partner_message_placeholder: Tell us about your organization and how you'd like to partner with us...
